column3: \cite{kim2016sequence} proposed that instead of minimizing cross-entropy with observed data, it is better to minimize cross-entropy with teacher's probability distribution.
column5: ["``Sequence-level knowledge distillation,''"]

column3: \cite{mirzadeh2019improved} presents improvements in knowledge distillation by using an intermediate network they call teacher assistant.
column5: ["``Improved knowledge distillation via teacher assistant: Bridging the gap between student and teacher,''"]
column6: ['Seyed-Iman Mirzadeh and Mehrdad Farajtabar and Ang Li and Hassan Ghasemzadeh']

column3: All security is modeled and proved using the simulation paradigm <cit.>.
column5: ['{How to Play any Mental Game or A Completeness Theorem for Protocols with Honest Majority}', '{S}ecurity and {C}omposition of {M}ultiparty {C}ryptographic {P}rotocols']

column3: Examples include Fairplay <cit.>, Wysteria <cit.>, ObliVM <cit.>, CBMC-GC <cit.>, SMCL <cit.>, <cit.>, Sharemind <cit.>, EzPC <cit.>, and SPDZ <cit.>.
column5: ['{Fairplay - Secure Two-Party Computation System}', '{Wysteria: A Programming Language for Generic, Mixed-Mode Multiparty Computations}', '{ObliVM: A Programming Framework for Secure Computation}', 'Secure two-party computations in {ANSI} {C}', '{A domain-specific programming language for secure multiparty computation}', '{Information-Flow Control for Programming on Encrypted Data}', '{S}haremind: {A} {F}ramework for {F}ast {P}rivacy-{P}reserving {C}omputations', '{EzPC}: {Programmable and Efficient Secure Two-Party Computation for Machine Learning}', '{G}eneralizing the {SPDZ} {C}ompiler {F}or {O}ther {P}rotocols']

column3: PySyft <cit.> and TF-Encrypted <cit.> are ongoing efforts that also aim to compile DNNs to protocols.
column5: ['{A generic framework for privacy preserving deep learning}', '{Private Machine Learning in TensorFlow using Secure Computation}']

column3: Fixed-point in .  Although the use of fixed-point for secure computations is well-known <cit.>, prior works on secure inference have addressed the float-to-fixed problem by either generating a fixed-point model by hand (<cit.>), or by using non-standard training algorithms that output fixed-point models (<cit.>).
column5: ['{Privacy-Preserving Ridge Regression on Hundreds of Millions of Records}']

column3: Finally, even with retraining, -generated binary/integer networks suffer significant accuracy loses <cit.> whereas Athos matches the accuracy of floating-point models.
column5: ['{Quantization and Training of Neural Networks for Efficient Integer-Arithmetic-Only Inference}']

column3: Some recent float-to-fixed schemes <cit.> show promise by quantizing floating-point models to 8-bit or 16-bit integers.
column5: ['{Compiling KB-Sized Machine Learning Models to Tiny IoT Devices}', '{Data-Free Quantization through Weight Equalization and Bias Correction}', '{Quantization and Training of Neural Networks for Efficient Integer-Arithmetic-Only Inference}']

column3: One could potentially use one of these systems in place of our float-to-fixed component – however, their compatibility with protocols <cit.> is unclear.
column5: ['{ABY}\\({}^{\\mbox{3}}\\): {A Mixed Protocol Framework for Machine Learning}', '{SecureNN: 3-Party Secure Computation for Neural Network Training}']

column3: Secure Machine Learning. There has been a flurry of recent results (<cit.>) in the area of secure machine learning, both in the 2-party <cit.>, as well as in the 3-party setting <cit.>.

The most relevant to our work are ABY <cit.> and SecureNN <cit.> that both provide 3-party semi-honest secure computation protocols for a variety of neural network inference and training algorithms, with somewhat similar performance guarantees.
column5: ['{ABY}\\({}^{\\mbox{3}}\\): {A Mixed Protocol Framework for Machine Learning}', '{SecureNN: 3-Party Secure Computation for Neural Network Training}']

column3: We also remark that there have been other recent works <cit.>, that modify the inference or training algorithms in order to obtain performance benefits.
column5: ['{XONN: XNOR-based Oblivious Deep Neural Network Inference}', '{CodedPrivateML: A Fast and Privacy-Preserving Framework for Distributed Machine Learning}', '{QUOTIENT:} {T}wo-{P}arty {S}ecure {N}eural {N}etwork {T}raining and {P}rediction', '{Outsourcing Private Machine Learning via Lightweight Secure Arithmetic Computation}', '{CHET}: {An Optimizing Compiler for Fully-Homomorphic Neural-Network Inferencing}', '{nGraph-HE}: {A} {G}raph {C}ompiler for {D}eep {L}earning on {H}omomorphically {E}ncrypted {D}ata', '{nGraph-HE2}: {A} {H}igh-{T}hroughput {F}ramework for {N}eural {N}etwork {I}nference on {E}ncrypted {D}ata', '{LevioSA: Lightweight Secure Arithmetic Computation}']
column6: [None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None]

column3: For example, the works that use fully homomorphic encryption (e.g., <cit.>)  do not support secure evaluation of ReLUs, XONN <cit.> requires DNNs to have binary weights, etc.
column5: ['{XONN: XNOR-based Oblivious Deep Neural Network Inference}', '{CHET}: {An Optimizing Compiler for Fully-Homomorphic Neural-Network Inferencing}', '{nGraph-HE}: {A} {G}raph {C}ompiler for {D}eep {L}earning on {H}omomorphically {E}ncrypted {D}ata', '{nGraph-HE2}: {A} {H}igh-{T}hroughput {F}ramework for {N}eural {N}etwork {I}nference on {E}ncrypted {D}ata']

column3: Prior works that use hardware enclaves for secure computation <cit.> assume that the enclave hides all data residing in it from the host.

column3: The only prior work that assumes a weaker trust assumption from the hardware is that of <cit.>.
column5: ['{Sealed-Glass Proofs: Using Transparent Enclaves to Prove and Sell Knowledge}']

column3: Politics and Polarization. Political parties involve user audience often through polarization, as well as by urging them to volunteer and campaign for the party <cit.>.
column5: ['Campaigning online: Web display ads in the 2012 presidential campaign']

column3: With most of the political discussion happening in the cyber-space, user experience leads the way of engagement and enchantment <cit.>.
column5: ['The experience of enchantment in human--computer interaction', 'Tweeting MPs: Digital Engagement between Citizens and Members of Parliament in the UK']

column3: For example, news personalization is a way to send curated news briefing to subscribers <cit.>.
column5: ['Selective exposure in the age of social media: Endorsements trump partisan source affiliation when selecting news online', 'The future of personalization at news websites: lessons from a longitudinal study']

column3: <cit.> coined dark money which is spent on negative ads.
column5: ['Dark Money and Dirty Politics: Are anonymous ads more negative?']

column3: Another selective political initiative is the highly polarized in US politics, studied by <cit.>.
column5: ['Illuminating an ecosystem of partisan websites']

column3: URL sharing of alternate news across the Web was studied in <cit.>.
column5: ['The web centipede: understanding how web communities influence each other through the lens of mainstream and alternative news sources']

column3: Examples include the use of NMF clustering () <cit.>, finding non-binary political ideological scores, sentiment analysis <cit.>, twitter profile data <cit.>, etc.
column5: ['Joint non-negative matrix factorization for learning ideological leaning on Twitter', 'Political tendency identification in twitter using sentiment analysis techniques', 'Democrats, republicans and starbucks afficionados: user classification in twitter']

column3: In <cit.>, authors measure the trackers per website and find that, on average, there are 10 different trackers per website; in news websites this average is 15 trackers.
column5: ['WhoTracks.Me: Monitoring the online tracking landscape at scale']

column3: Similarly, in <cit.>, authors used Alexa top 500 websites for each of the 16 basic content categories of Alexa.
column5: ['Online tracking: A 1-million-site measurement and analysis']

column3: In <cit.>, researchers measured differences in third party cookies offloaded on a browser by collecting data from real users over a period of 1 year, before and after the GDPR regulation <cit.>, and found that the number of cookies does not change, not least because users tend to pay little attention to the GDPR options.
column5: ['Characterising Third Party Cookie Usage in the EU after GDPR', 'Rules for the protection of personal data inside and outside the EU']

column3: In <cit.>, researchers were the first to analyze the technique of synchronizing different user IDs that various entities set for the same user, thus reducing the user's anonymity on the Web.
column5: ['Selling off privacy at auction']

column3: In <cit.>, researchers measure the costs of digital advertising and use CS as a metric for the reduction of user's privacy.
column5: ['The Cost of Digital Advertisement: Comparing User and Advertiser Views']

column3: Also, <cit.> conducted a thorough analysis of CS by analyzing a year-long dataset of real mobile users and showed that CS increases the number of domains that track a user's browsing by a factor of 6.75.
column5: ['Cookie Synchronization: Everything You Always Wanted to Know But Were Afraid to Ask']

column3: In <cit.> authors show that CS can break users' secure SSL sessions and increase their identifiability on the Web, even if they browse over VPN.
column5: ['Exclusive: How the (Synced) Cookie Monster Breached My Encrypted VPN Session']

column3: In <cit.>, authors study CS together with re-spawning cookies and investigate how these two can form persistent cookies that users cannot abolish even after clearing their cookie jar.
column5: ['The web never forgets: Persistent tracking mechanisms in the wild']

column3: In <cit.>, authors simulate users browsing the web in an attempt to study the possibility of a passive eavesdropper leveraging third party HTTP tracking cookies for mass monitoring.
column5: ['Cookies that give you away: The surveillance implications of web tracking']

column3: Biases in Online Ecosystem. In an attempt to shed light over today's opaque online ad-ecosystem, <cit.> proposed Sunlight: a system to detect targeting in large-scale experiments with statistically justifiable results.
column5: ['Sunlight: Fine-grained targeting detection at scale with statistical confidence']

column3: Similarly, <cit.> developed a content-agnostic methodology to detect client- and server-side flows of information between ad-exchanges by leveraging retargeted ads.
column5: ['Tracing Information Flows Between Ad Exchanges Using Retargeted Ads']

column3: In <cit.>, user browsing history is studied to define audience gender and age demographics.
column5: ['Targeted Advertising Based on Browsing History']

column3: Evidences of bias in ad-placement is given by <cit.>.
column5: ['Automated experiments on ad privacy settings']

column3: In <cit.>, authors studied 5 million paid ads on Facebook and claim that US users are mostly targeted by foreign groups using loopholes in regulations of Facebook.
column5: ['The stealth media? Groups and targets behind divisive issue campaigns on Facebook']

column5: ['{ABY}\\({}^{\\mbox{3}}\\): {A Mixed Protocol Framework for Machine Learning}', '{SecureNN: 3-Party Secure Computation for Neural Network Training}']

column3: We also remark that there have been other recent works <cit.>, that modify the inference or training algorithms in order to obtain performance benefits.
column5: ['{XONN: XNOR-based Oblivious Deep Neural Network Inference}', '{CodedPrivateML: A Fast and Privacy-Preserving Framework for Distributed Machine Learning}', '{QUOTIENT:} {T}wo-{P}arty {S}ecure {N}eural {N}etwork {T}raining and {P}rediction', '{Outsourcing Private Machine Learning via Lightweight Secure Arithmetic Computation}', '{CHET}: {An Optimizing Compiler for Fully-Homomorphic Neural-Network Inferencing}', '{nGraph-HE}: {A} {G}raph {C}ompiler for {D}eep {L}earning on {H}omomorphically {E}ncrypted {D}ata', '{nGraph-HE2}: {A} {H}igh-{T}hroughput {F}ramework for {N}eural {N}etwork {I}nference on {E}ncrypted {D}ata', '{LevioSA: Lightweight Secure Arithmetic Computation}']

column3: In <cit.>, researchers measured differences in third party cookies offloaded on a browser by collecting data from real users over a period of 1 year, before and after the GDPR regulation <cit.>, and found that the number of cookies does not change, not least because users tend to pay little attention to the GDPR options.
column5: ['Characterising Third Party Cookie Usage in the EU after GDPR', 'Rules for the protection of personal data inside and outside the EU']

column3: In <cit.>, researchers were the first to analyze the technique of synchronizing different user IDs that various entities set for the same user, thus reducing the user's anonymity on the Web.
column5: ['Selling off privacy at auction']

column3: In <cit.>, researchers measure the costs of digital advertising and use CS as a metric for the reduction of user's privacy.
column5: ['The Cost of Digital Advertisement: Comparing User and Advertiser Views']

column3: Also, <cit.> conducted a thorough analysis of CS by analyzing a year-long dataset of real mobile users and showed that CS increases the number of domains that track a user's browsing by a factor of 6.75.
column5: ['Cookie Synchronization: Everything You Always Wanted to Know But Were Afraid to Ask']

column3: In <cit.> authors show that CS can break users' secure SSL sessions and increase their identifiability on the Web, even if they browse over VPN.
column5: ['Exclusive: How the (Synced) Cookie Monster Breached My Encrypted VPN Session']

column3: In <cit.>, authors study CS together with re-spawning cookies and investigate how these two can form persistent cookies that users cannot abolish even after clearing their cookie jar.
column5: ['The web never forgets: Persistent tracking mechanisms in the wild']

column3: In <cit.>, authors simulate users browsing the web in an attempt to study the possibility of a passive eavesdropper leveraging third party HTTP tracking cookies for mass monitoring.
column5: ['Cookies that give you away: The surveillance implications of web tracking']

column5: ['Sunlight: Fine-grained targeting detection at scale with statistical confidence']

column3: Fixed-point in .  Although the use of fixed-point for secure computations is well-known <cit.>, prior works on secure inference have addressed the float-to-fixed problem by either generating a fixed-point model by hand (<cit.>), or by using non-standard training algorithms that output fixed-point models (<cit.>).
column5: ['{Privacy-Preserving Ridge Regression on Hundreds of Millions of Records}']

column3: Finally, even with retraining, -generated binary/integer networks suffer significant accuracy loses <cit.> whereas Athos matches the accuracy of floating-point models.
column5: ['{Quantization and Training of Neural Networks for Efficient Integer-Arithmetic-Only Inference}']

column3: Some recent float-to-fixed schemes <cit.> show promise by quantizing floating-point models to 8-bit or 16-bit integers.
column5: ['{Compiling KB-Sized Machine Learning Models to Tiny IoT Devices}', '{Data-Free Quantization through Weight Equalization and Bias Correction}', '{Quantization and Training of Neural Networks for Efficient Integer-Arithmetic-Only Inference}']

column3: One could potentially use one of these systems in place of our float-to-fixed component – however, their compatibility with protocols <cit.> is unclear.

column3: SNNs have been a topic of active research with advances in architecture designs , training methodologies ,  and practical deployments , .
column5: ["``Deep learning in spiking neural networks,''", "``Learning to be efficient: Algorithms for training low-latency, low-compute deep spiking neural networks,''", "``Direct training for spiking neural networks: Faster, larger, better,''", "``Resparc: A reconfigurable and energy-efficient architecture with memristive crossbars for deep spiking neural networks,''", "``Mapping spiking neural networks onto a manycore neuromorphic architecture,''"]
column6: ['Amirhossein Tavanaei and Masoud Ghodrati and Saeed Reza Kheradpisheh', 'Daniel Neil and Michael Pfeiffer and Shih-Chii Liu', 'Yujie Wu and Lei Deng and Guoqi Li and Jun Zhu and Yuan Xie and Luping Shi', 'Aayush Ankit and Abhronil Sengupta and Priyadarshini Panda and Kaushik Roy', 'Chit-Kwan Lin and Andreas Wild and Gautham N Chinya and Tsung-Han Lin and Mike Davies and  Hong Wang']

column3: They have been successfully applied to diverse pattern recognition tasks from object recognition  to EEG classification .
column5: ["``Spiking deep convolutional neural networks for energy-efficient object recognition,''", "``Spiking neural networks applied to the classification of motor tasks in eeg signals,''"]
column6: ['Yongqiang Cao and Yang Chen and Deepak Khosla', 'and et al']

column3: Recently there have been works that show SNNs achieve comparable performances as the deep neural network architectures like VGG16 and Res-Nets for image classification tasks .
column5: ["``Going deeper in spiking neural networks: Vgg and residual architectures,''"]
column6: ['Abhronil Sengupta and Yuting Ye and Robert Wang and Chiao Liu and Kaushik Roy']

column3: On similar lines, Kim et al.  presented a first spike-based object detection model, called Spiking-YOLO.
column5: ["``Spiking-yolo: Spiking neural network for real-time object detection,''"]
column6: ['Seijoon Kim and Seongsik Park and Byunggook Na and Sungroh Yoon']

column3: Lee et al.  proposed a modified back-propagation based approach where the membrane potentials are treated as differentiable signals, and discontinuities at spike times are considered as noise.
column5: ["``Training deep spiking neural networks using backpropagation,''"]
column6: ['Jun Haeng Lee and Tobi Delbruck and Michael Pfeiffer']

column3: There is also a training methodology that considers the relative timing between the pre-synaptic and post-synaptic spikes to influence the training of synaptic weights via an asymmetric learning window .
column5: ["``Hebbian learning and spiking neurons,''"]
column6: ['Richard Kempter and Wulfram Gerstner and J Leo Van Hemmen']

column3: Yin et al.  proposed an SNN training algorithm with continuous integration, which can handle input spikes with temporal information.
column5: ["``Algorithm and hardware design of discrete-time spiking neural networks based on back propagation with binary activations,''"]
column6: ['Shihui Yin and Shreyas K Venkataramanaiah and Gregory K Chen and Ram Krishnamurthy']

column3: There are also Hebbian learning  based approaches that enable local training, unlike back-propagation.
column5: ["``Hebbian learning with winner take all for spiking neural networks,''"]

column3: and was later applied and popularized for deep neural networks by Hinton et al. .
column5: ["``Model compression,''", "``Distilling the knowledge in a neural network,''"]
column6: ['Cristian Buciluǎ and Rich Caruana and Alexandru Niculescu-Mizil', 'Geoffrey Hinton and Oriol Vinyals and Jeff Dean']

column3: Bucilua et al.  use the final softmax outputs of a larger ANN to learn a smaller model by minimizing the squared difference between their activations.
column5: ["``Model compression,''"]
column6: ['Cristian Buciluǎ and Rich Caruana and Alexandru Niculescu-Mizil']

column3: The method in  is a more general one where the output logits are scaled by a temperature parameter to obtain soft thresholds and then used in the loss.
column5: ["``Distilling the knowledge in a neural network,''"]
column6: ['Geoffrey Hinton and Oriol Vinyals and Jeff Dean']

column3: KD has been an active area of research with major applications in model compression .
column5: ["``A survey of model compression and acceleration for deep neural networks,''"]
column6: ['Yu Cheng and Duo Wang and Pan Zhou and Tao Zhang']

column3: There have also been works that demonstrate improvement in the performance of a model when using KD based learning, e.g., in object detection .
column5: ["``Learning efficient object detection models with knowledge distillation,''"]
column6: ['Guobin Chen and Wongun Choi and Xiang Yu and Tony Han and Manmohan Chandraker']

column3: In addition to this, KD has also been used to improve the performance of various pattern recognition tasks when used as a training methodology for language understanding in  and sequence models in .
column5: ["``Improving multi-task deep neural networks via knowledge distillation for natural language understanding,''", "``Knowledge distillation for sequence model.,''"]
column6: ['Xiaodong Liu and Pengcheng He and Weizhu Chen and Jianfeng Gao', 'Mingkun Huang and Yongbin You and Zhehuai Chen and Yanmin Qian and Kai Yu']

column3: On similar lines, the work by Kim et al.  proposed that instead of minimizing cross-entropy with observed data, it is better to minimize cross-entropy with teacher's probability distribution.
column5: ["``Sequence-level knowledge distillation,''"]

column3: A recent work by Mirzadeh et al.  presents improvements in knowledge distillation by using an intermediate network they call teacher assistant.
column5: ["``Improved knowledge distillation via teacher assistant: Bridging the gap between student and teacher,''"]
column6: ['Seyed-Iman Mirzadeh and Mehrdad Farajtabar and Ang Li and Hassan Ghasemzadeh']
